comments:
When I try to import a local access log with a filter that shows the first 10 events I get the following null pointer exception:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.FileWriter.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.outputters.CBEFileOutputter.setFileWriter(CBEFileOutputter.java:314)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.outputters.CBEFileOutputter.writeToFile(CBEFileOutputter.java:79)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.outputters.CBEFileOutputter.processCBEs(CBEFileOutputter.java:108)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.outputters.CBEFileOutputter.processEventItems(CBEFileOutputter.java:69)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.ProcessUnit.flushEventItems(ProcessUnit.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.BasicContext.flushMessages(BasicContext.java:356)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.BasicContext.flushMessages(BasicContext.java:376)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.BasicContext.flushMessages(BasicContext.java:376)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.BasicContext.stop(BasicContext.java:331)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.Context.handleControledStop(Context.java:550)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.impl.BasicContext.run(BasicContext.java:183)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

This is caused by the BasicContext.flushMessages being called for a disabled component, in this case the CBEFileOutputter. The fix is to not call the flushMessages method for disabled components.  I'll attach a patch.  Please test it.

Created an attachment (id=50739)
Patch to org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter plugin
Suggested fix was tested by Sheldon. Committed fix to TPTP Head CVS.
